Package mpmToolbox.supplementary.orthantNeighborhoodGraph

Class ONGNode

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.geom.Point2D
      • java.awt.geom.Point2D.Double
        • mpmToolbox.supplementary.orthantNeighborhoodGraph.ONGNode
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ScoreNode
    public class ONGNode
extends java.awt.geom.Point2D.Double
    This represents a node in an Orthant Neighborhood Graph. The implementation is for the 2D case. This is based on Tobias Germer's Orthant Neighborhood Graph, but the algorithms are different.
    Author:
    Axel Berndt
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • getNearestNeighbor

        public meico.supplementary.KeyValue<ONGNode,​java.lang.Double> getNearestNeighbor()
        finds the nearest neighbor in the graph and returns it together with the square distance
        Returns:
        the nearest neighbor or a tuple (null, Double.MAX_VALUE) if there is no neighbor

        Parameters:

      • getSecondNearestNeighbor

        public ONGNode getSecondNearestNeighbor​(int quadrant)
        this method returns the second nearest neighbor of this node in the specified quadrant
        Parameters:
        quadrant -
        Returns:
        the second nearest neighbor in the specified quadrant or null

      • findSecondNearestNeighborCandidates

        private void findSecondNearestNeighborCandidates​(ONGNode pivot,
                                                 int quadrant,
                                                 int backQuad,
                                                 int rightQuad,
                                                 int leftQuad,
                                                 java.util.ArrayList<ONGNode> candidates)
        a helper method to determine the second nearest neighbor of a node
        Parameters:
        pivot - the node for which we seek the second nearest neighbor
        quadrant - the quadrant of pivot in which we seek the second nearest neighbor
        backQuad - a quadrant index we don't want to compute again
        rightQuad - a quadrant index we don't want to compute again
        leftQuad - a quadrant index we don't want to compute again
        candidates - a list of candidate nodes for second nearest neighbor, it gets filled in the process

      • findNearestNeighborOf

        public meico.supplementary.KeyValue<ONGNode,​java.lang.Double> findNearestNeighborOf​(double x,
                                                                                          double y)
        navigate to the node nearest to the specified coordinates and return it
        Parameters:
        x -
        y -
        Returns:
        the nearest node to the coordinates in question and its squared distance to the coordinates

      • findNearestNeighborOf

        private meico.supplementary.KeyValue<ONGNode,​java.lang.Double> findNearestNeighborOf​(ONGNode node,
                                                                                           java.util.TreeSet<ONGNode> visited,
                                                                                           java.lang.Double nearestDistance)
        navigate to the node nearest to the specified node's coordinates and return it
        Parameters:
        node -
        visited -
        nearestDistance -
        Returns:
        the nearest node to the coordinates in question and its squared distance to the coordinates or null if this node has already been visited/excluded from the search space

      • setAllNearestNeighborsOf

        protected ONGNode setAllNearestNeighborsOf​(double x,
                                           double y)
        Find the specified position's nearest neighbors and write them to a new node's neighbors array. The node is returned but NOT added to the graph.
        Parameters:
        x -
        y -
        Returns:
        a node with the neighborhood set that belongs to the coordinates, the node is NOT added to the graph

      • setAllNearestNeighborsOf

        protected ONGNode setAllNearestNeighborsOf​(ONGNode node,
                                           java.util.TreeSet<ONGNode> visited)
        Recursively traverse the graph, find the specified node's nearest neighbors and write them to the node's neighbors array.
        Parameters:
        node - the node can or cannot be in the graph
        visited - with this treeset we keep track of nodes already visited so we do not get into loops
        Returns:
        if a node was found at the exact same position of node (could even be the node itself) it is returned to indicate "collision", otherwise null

      • findMyInverseNeighbors

        public java.util.ArrayList<meico.supplementary.KeyValue<ONGNode,​java.lang.Integer>> findMyInverseNeighbors()
        This method finds the inverse neighbors of this, i.e. those nodes in the graph that (would) have this as nearest neighbor. This can or cannot be in the graph, however, its nearest neighbors from the graph must already be set (setAllNearestNeighborsOf())!
        Returns:
        all nodes that (would) have this as nearest neighbor together with the respective quadrant index in which this would lie

      • findMeInverseNeighborsOf

        private void findMeInverseNeighborsOf​(ONGNode pivot,
                                      java.util.ArrayList<meico.supplementary.KeyValue<ONGNode,​java.lang.Integer>> results,
                                      java.util.ArrayList<ONGNode>[] deadZones)
        a helper method for finding the inverse direct neighbors
        Parameters:
        pivot -
        results - the hashmap of all nodes that (would) have pivot as nearest neighbor together with the respective quadrant index in which pivot would lie
        deadZones - list of nodes already visited and their "dead space", so this node can check if it falls in one of those regions
